gametools

Class Sound

  • java.lang.Object
    • gametools.Sound

  • public class Sound
extends java.lang.Object
    An easy to use class for sound playback that wraps the java clip class.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Sound(java.lang.String path)
      Creates a sound and opens the file at the passed in path.
      Note: This class only has support for certain encodings of wav files.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      javax.sound.sampled.Clip getClip()
      Returns the clip the sound is using for more advanced operations.
      Note: Some changes to the clip may cause unexpected behavior in the sound class.
      float getVolume()
      Returns the relative volume of the sound, where zero is the default volume, negative numbers mean quieter and positive numbers mean louder than the default.
      boolean isPlaying() 
      void loop()
      Loops the sound infinitely.
      void pause(boolean pause)
      Pauses or resumes the sound.
      void play()
      Plays the full sound once.
      void reset()
      Sets the sound back to the start without interrupting playback.
      void setVolume(float vol)
      Sets the relative volume of the sound, where zero is the default volume, negative numbers mean quieter and positive numbers mean louder than the default.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Sound

        public Sound(java.lang.String path)
        Creates a sound and opens the file at the passed in path.
        Note: This class only has support for certain encodings of wav files.
        Parameters:
        path - The location of the sound file relative to the package of the project.

    • Method Detail

      • getVolume

        public float getVolume()
        Returns the relative volume of the sound, where zero is the default volume, negative numbers mean quieter and positive numbers mean louder than the default.
        Returns:

      • play

        public void play()
        Plays the full sound once.

      • loop

        public void loop()
        Loops the sound infinitely.

      • pause

        public void pause(boolean pause)
        Pauses or resumes the sound.
        Parameters:
        pause - Whether to pause the sound or to resume it from pause.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Sets the sound back to the start without interrupting playback.

      • setVolume

        public void setVolume(float vol)
        Sets the relative volume of the sound, where zero is the default volume, negative numbers mean quieter and positive numbers mean louder than the default.
        Parameters:
        vol - The new relative volume of the sound.

      • isPlaying

        public boolean isPlaying()
        Returns:
        True if the sound is not paused and is currently playing.

      • getClip

        public javax.sound.sampled.Clip getClip()
        Returns the clip the sound is using for more advanced operations.
        Note: Some changes to the clip may cause unexpected behavior in the sound class.
        Returns:
